alert.note: Alert for Eastern, Central, and Southern Searcy County Higher Elevations; Pope County Higher Elevations; Southeast Van Buren County; Stone; Van Buren County Higher Elevations (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 12:02AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Stone, southern Searcy, northern Van Buren and northeastern Pope Counties through 1245 AM CDT... At 1202 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Witts Spring, or 18 miles southwest of Marshall, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clinton... Fairfield Bay... Shirley... Kay... Witts Spring... Rocky Hill... Dabney... Smyrna... Bohannon... Elba... Woolum... Imo... Old Lexington... Watts... Leslie... Alread... Rupert... Dennard... Tilly... Botkinburg... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for central and north central Arkansas.
